translated: The Paṭṭhāna🔽The reverse order of the dependent origination, the Triad-based Reversal of the Paṭṭhāna

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sekkhattika

original: Nasekkhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asekkho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sekkham dhammam paṭicca asekkhaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A phenomenon of the trainee arises in dependence on a phenomenon of the non-trainee as root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… āsevane cha …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe āsevane cha pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: In the case of root-cause, there are eighteen; in the case of object, nine; … in the case of nutriment, six; … in the case of faculty, six; … in the case of absorption, three; … in the case of path, one; … in the case of non-obstruction, eighteen.
